Text: The expression "Giant of Castelnau" refers to three bone fragments (a humerus, tibia, and femoral mid-shaft) discovered by Georges Vacher de Lapouge in 1890 in the sediment used to cover a Bronze Age burial tumulus, and then possibly dating back to the Neolithic.

<Text: Giant of Castelnau:  He estimated from the bone size that the human may have been about 3.50 metres tall.
